title: Bayern Munich vs Arsenal LIVE : Women Champions League latest score and updates after Lea Schuller goal
body_text:
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal LIVE: Women‚Äôs Champions League result and final score after Lea Schuller goal
Arsenal take on Bayern Munich in the Women‚Äôs Champions League quarter-finals as the knockout stages get underway in Germany tonight.
The Gunners topped Group C ahead of current holders Lyon having won four of their six matches during the group stages. Jonas Eidevall‚Äôs side impressed over the first stage of this competition, scoring 19 goals and conceding just five but have struggled to get past the quarter-final stage in recent seasons ‚Äì they were knocked out 3-1 on aggregate to Wolfsburg last year.
Bayern also seem to stumble at this stage of the tournament. The German side have reached the last-eight in five of the previous six seasons but have only progressed to the semis twice and have never reached the Champions League final. Their 4-3 aggregate defeat after extra time against PSG last year saw a 2-1 loss in the home leg but they will take confidence from the fact that they won all three of their group stage home games this term, including against Barcelona.
Follow all the action as the Women‚Äôs Champions League knockout rounds get underway:
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
Bayern Munich host Arsenal in the Women‚Äôs Champions League quarter-final first leg
How to watch the Women‚Äôs Champions League for free
70‚Äô OFF THE LINE! Both Blackstenius and Williamson denied by clearances (BAY 1-0 ARS)
52‚Äô POST! Arsenal close to an equaliser but Foord shot hits upright (BAY 1-0 ARS)
39‚Äô GOAL! Bayern take the lead thanks to towering header from Schuller (BAY 1-0 ARS)
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:31 , Jamie Braidwood
85 mins: SAVE! Big stop from Zinsberger to deny the rampaging Rall, who fired straight at the goalkeeper following a counter-attack. That was almost a killer blow from Bayern.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:30 , Jamie Braidwood
84 mins: Arsenal have lost a little of their attacking momentum and Bayern are starting to breathe a little more comfortably.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:26 , Jamie Braidwood
81 mins: Bit of a strange one for Arsenal, as Blackstenius is replaced by Kuhl with around 15 minutes remaining. Arsenal now are without a recognised striker.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:23 , Jamie Braidwood
78 mins: Another Bayern block! This time it‚Äôs slipped into Foord, but Rall is there to block the shot from inside the box.
Bayern withdraw the goalscorer Schuller.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:21 , Jamie Braidwood
75 mins: It‚Äôs been near-constant attack from Arsenal in this second half, but Eidevall‚Äôs side are still searching for their first goal of this quarter-final tie. Defeat would be cruel after this second half performance.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:17 , Jamie Braidwood
72 mins: At the other end, McCabe makes a brilliant sliding challenge to deny Schuller, who had made a break.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:14 , Jamie Braidwood
70 mins: OFF THE LINE AGAIN! How have Arsenal not scored?! From the corner, Foord heads it back across and Williamson‚Äôs shot from five yards is cleared by Schuller!
Arsenal are appealing for a backpass after Bayern gather, but nothing is given!
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:12 , Jamie Braidwood
67 mins: Bayern are preparing changes as Arsenal are well on top now. McCabe has moved to left back and shoots wide after drifting inside. The angle wasn‚Äôt there.
Now Foord, who at times is looking to do this by herself, cuts inside and her shot is blocked behind.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:08 , Jamie Braidwood
63 mins: Arsenal find Blackstenius again in the box but this time Vigg√≥sd√≥ttir makes the crucial intervention with the block.
Arsenal are really pushing now.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:05 , Jamie Braidwood
61 mins: OFF THE LINE! Arsenal are so close again! It‚Äôs brilliant defending from Kumagai, who is able to scramble back and clear Blackstenius‚Äô header from the goalline.
It came following an Arsenal free kick, which caused chaos in the Bayern box.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
19:03 , Jamie Braidwood
58 mins: Good defending from Wienroither at the back post. The right back is able to block Schuller‚Äôs effort as the striker lined up a volley following a switch.
It‚Äôs Wienroither‚Äôs last action, though, as Pelova comes on.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:59 , Jamie Braidwood
54 mins: Foord tries again after a brilliant turn on Rall. She went for the same shot but didn‚Äôt quite catch it, and Grohs gathers.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:56 , Jamie Braidwood
52 mins: OFF THE POST! So close from Foord! She cuts inside and curls an excellent shot towards the far corner, but it‚Äôs against the bottom of the upright! So unlucky.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:55 , Jamie Braidwood
51 mins: A couple of neat touches from Blackstenius helps Arsenal progress up the pitch, but the striker‚Äôs shot from outside of the box is blocked by Maanum.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:53 , Jamie Braidwood
48 mins: Foord crunches into Lohmann and picks up the game‚Äôs first yellow card. Quite a frustrated challenge from the Australian.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:48 , Jamie Braidwood
Back underway in Munich.
HALF TIME! Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:43 , Jamie Braidwood
Here‚Äôs the goal which has given Bayern the lead. Such a fine header.
LEA SCH√úLLER GETS HER HEADER IN TO GIVE BAYERN THE LEAD üî•#UWCL WATCH NOW ‚¨áÔ∏è
üá¨üáß https://t.co/onl6qxSLkQ
üá©üá™ https://t.co/UJWMYqbMMx pic.twitter.com/MwAr9pkFqj‚Äî DAZN Football (@DAZNFootball) March 21, 2023
HALF TIME! Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:33 , Jamie Braidwood
And there‚Äôs the half-time whistle. Maybe Arsenal are fortunate after all that‚Äôs it‚Äôs only 1-0.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:33 , Jamie Braidwood
44 mins: CHANCE! Schuller could have had a hat-trick in this half alone. The forward is slipped through as another ball splits Williamson and Rafaelle. Her shot this tme is lifted, but just drifts wide.
Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal
18:32 , Jamie Braidwood
43 mins: Eidevall follows Williamson in roaring at the Arsenal players - the Gunners were right in this until the goal but they must pick themselves up and go again.
GOAL! Bayern Munich 1-0 Arsenal (Schuller 39‚Äô)
18:26 , Jamie Braidwood
What a header! Bayern lead through their top scorer and it‚Äôs a moment of class from the striker! Schuller drifts into the space between Williamson and Wienroither at the back post and powers a header into the top corner, beating Zinsberger.
It was a wonderful cross from the right back Rall.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:24 , Jamie Braidwood
35 mins: Now it‚Äôs Arsenal‚Äôs turn to attack, with this first leg remaining on such a fine edge. McCabe first picked out Blackstenius with a clever ball, but Bayern were able to clear her cross. Then the striker‚Äôs touch let her down on the edge of the box.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:19 , Jamie Braidwood
31 mins: SAVE! Rafaelle is caught again with a ball that finds Schuller‚Äôs run in behind. Bayern‚Äôs top scorer takes another early shot, this time at Zinsberger‚Äôs near post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:16 , Jamie Braidwood
28 mins: The momentum has swung back in Bayern‚Äôs favour. Arsenal have been caught a couple of times with direct balls forward by Bayern.
It‚Äôs still nicely poised at 0-0, though.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:13 , Jamie Braidwood
25 mins: The ball sits up nicely for Stanway on the edge of the box after Magull cut inside. The England international took the volley on but it‚Äôs dragged wide.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:11 , Jamie Braidwood
23 mins: CLOSE! Schuller is inches away from giving Bayern the lead! Raffaelle slips as Bayern quickly launch a counter. The striker takes on the shot early from outside the box but the shot whistles past the Zinsberger‚Äôs post.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:08 , Jamie Braidwood
19 mins: Chance! Williamson makes a burst from defence and Blackstenius is slipped in. The striker can‚Äôt squeeze a shot in but it breaks to Maanum in the area, but the midfielder is blocked from close range.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:05 , Jamie Braidwood
17 mins: Arsenal will be happy with how they are able to play through Bayern here. Williamson and Walti are getting time to pick their passes through the press and Eidevall‚Äôs side are able to control the game.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
18:02 , Jamie Braidwood
14 mins: Foord finds space again on the left but Bayern are able to show the Australian down the line this time. The cross drifts behind.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
17:58 , Jamie Braidwood
11 mins: Chance! Excellent play from Foord again to cut inside and whip a cross into the box. Blackstenius is free in the middle but can‚Äôt keep the header down! The striker should have scored and that‚Äôs a let off for Bayern.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
17:57 , Jamie Braidwood
10 mins: Arsenal have been able to ride out that fast start from Bayern and are seeing more of the ball now. The Bayern press is ferocious in midfield, though, and the Gunners will need to be careful.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
17:55 , Jamie Braidwood
8 mins: Foord cuts inside and take aim at goal from range. It‚Äôs blocked by Vigg√≥sd√≥ttir, seemingly with the arm, but it‚Äôs not looked at any further.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
17:54 , Jamie Braidwood
6 mins: Arsenal are able to sustain their first attack as Maanum is able to receive a pass through the lines and turn. The Norwegian has been one of the players of the tournament so far for Arsenal.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
17:51 , Jamie Braidwood
3 mins: Bayern are being aggressive with their press in the early stages, especially towards Walti in midfield. The German side continue to be on the front foot. Buhl‚Äôs free kick from the right drifts all the way through.
Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
17:49 , Jamie Braidwood
1 min: Bayern make a fast start as a ball in towards Schuller causes a panic in the Arsenal box. Stanway then crunches into Walti in midfield and Buhl‚Äôs shot needs to be blocked by Williamson.
KICK-OFF! Bayern Munich 0-0 Arsenal
17:46 , Jamie Braidwood
Underway at the Allianz!
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
17:44 , Jamie Braidwood
So here we go! It‚Äôs the first competitive meeting between Bayern Munich and Arsenal and the clash comes as both teams are desperate to reach the Champions League semi-finals. Arsenal are without an appearance in the last four in 10 years, while Bayern have also been short of semi-final appearances despite regular trips to the quarter-finals.
Around 18,000 tickets have been sold for this opening match of the Women‚Äôs Champions League knockout stages, and it‚Äôs live next!
How to watch the Women‚Äôs Champions League
17:38 , Jamie Braidwood
Every game in this season‚Äôs Women‚Äôs Champions League knockout stages is being broadcast live on streaming platform DAZN, and also on DAZN‚Äôs YouTube channel. You can set reminders to receive a notification of when the stream goes live, which is 15 minutes before the start of each match
You can sign up to DAZN where the matches will also be streamed for free across their digital platforms. The YouTube stream will also be embedded in the Uefa.com and on Uefa.tv for all Women‚Äôs Champions League games.
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal - Champions League talking points
17:28 , Jamie Braidwood
Injury-hit Arsenal aim to end last-four absence
Arsenal, the only English club to have won the competition, back in 2007, are looking to reach the semis for the first time in 10 years, facing German opposition at this stage again after being eliminated in the 2021-22 quarter-finals by Wolfsburg.
Jonas Eidevall‚Äôs side made a very eye-catching start in their group this term, winning 5-1 at eight-time and defending champions Lyon, and would finish top of the pool ‚Äì but by the final round of games had suffered the significant blow of losing forwards Beth Mead and Vivianne Miedema to ACL injuries.
The club re-signed veteran striker Jodie Taylor last week but she is not part of their Champions League squad. Currently fourth in the Women‚Äôs Super League, they have won each of the last three games, including beating Chelsea 3-1 in the League Cup final.
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
17:19 , Jamie Braidwood
Champions League quarter-final preview
As Arsenal travelled to Bayern Munich looking to reach what used to be familiar ground in the Women‚Äôs Champions League, Jonas Eidevall did not need to look back far to remind his players how transformative victory can be. It has been 10 years since Arsenal, the only English team to win a European title, last reached the semi-finals. Progress now would be timely, and not just for Arsenal‚Äôs development under Eidevall. It would be a significant moment for English clubs in the Champions League, as well as the tournament as a whole.
Over the past four seasons, only six teams have reached the Champions League semi-finals: Lyon, Barcelona, Paris Saint-Germain, Wolfsburg, Bayern Munich and Chelsea. It is down to Arsenal defeating Bayern, or Roma stunning Barcelona, to change that line-up. That in itself is striking, given how long Arsenal were the standard bearers in women‚Äôs football in England, but in recent years it has been left to Chelsea to carry that charge amid an underperformance by Women‚Äôs Super League clubs in Europe.
Can Arsenal break through the Champions League‚Äôs glass ceiling?
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
17:12 , Jamie Braidwood
An early reunion between Leah Williamson and Georgia Stanway tonight!
That #Lionesses love! ü•∞pic.twitter.com/zWZEp32AiW
‚Äî Lionesses (@Lionesses) March 21, 2023
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
17:02 , Jamie Braidwood
Arsenal manager Jonas Eidevall on Bayern Munich‚Äôs record of winning 12 of their last 13 home Champions League fixtures.
‚ÄúWe have respect for but we shouldn‚Äôt fear it. We‚Äôve been playing against teams that have had great home records this year in the Champions League.
‚ÄúBoth Lyon and Juventus are two teams that have excellent home records in the Champions League and we managed to draw in Turin and won at Lyon.
‚ÄúWe know we‚Äôre going to play against a good team but we‚Äôre also a good team. There is a lot of similarities in the way both teams play. It‚Äôs an exciting match-up.‚Äù
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal - Team news!
16:47 , Jamie Braidwood
Arsenal make one change from the team that started against Reading last week, with Stina Blackstenius recalled in place of Lotte Wubben-Moy. It means Steph Catley misses out again due to a foot problem, so Noelle Maritz continues at left back with Katie McCabe staying on the wing.
Georgia Stanway starts for Bayern, who line up as expected.
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal - Team news!
16:39 , Jamie Braidwood
Bayern: Grohs; Rall, Vigg√≥sd√≥ttir, Kumagai, Hansen; Stanway, Zadrazil; Magull, Lohmann, B√ºhl; Sch√ºller
Arsenal: Zinsberger; Wienroither, Williamson, Raffaelle, Martiz; Maanum, Little, W√§lti; McCabe, Blackstenius, Foord
OUR STARTING XI ‚úä #ChampionsLeagueQF üèÜ pic.twitter.com/eL2h1xdczU
‚Äî Arsenal Women (@ArsenalWFC) March 21, 2023
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal - Champions League talking points
16:32 , Jamie Braidwood
Familiar foe at Bayern
The Gunners go up against a Bayern outfit featuring England midfielder Georgia Stanway. After leaving Manchester City to join the Bundesliga club last summer, the 24-year-old scored three goals in their group-stage games, two in a late brace that secured a 3-2 victory at Benfica.
Bayern, who finished second behind Barcelona in Group D but on the same amount of points (15), have twice before reached the Champions League semi-finals, in 2019 and 2021; last season they bowed out in the quarters with defeat over two legs to PSG.
They are second in the German top flight at the moment, two points behind Wolfsburg, and on a 12-match winning streak in all competitions.
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
16:25 , Jamie Braidwood
Arsenal have triggered the one-year option on Manuela Zinsberger‚Äôs contract, keeping the former Bayern goalkeeper at the north London club until the end of next season.
The Austrian left the Bavarian club on a free transfer in May 2019 after five years to sign with Arsenal and her existing deal was due to expire at the end of this campaign.
But last season‚Äôs WSL Golden Glove winner had no doubt in extending her stay in the capital.
‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt a tough decision at all,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy I‚Äôm staying for another season and I‚Äôm looking forward to the game here.
‚ÄúI love Bayern Munich and Munich itself - it‚Äôs close to my family. Looking back, I‚Äôm grateful and happy with what I‚Äôve achieved with Bayern but I‚Äôm wearing another jersey here and I‚Äôm also happy with that.‚Äù
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
16:18 , Jamie Braidwood
Arsenal boss Jonas Eidevall ahead of Bayern Munich fixture: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre a team that is in a good place right now.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if this is good or bad but I felt with the preparation lately, I have had a feeling of sharing less information with the players because I‚Äôm more sure that we know what to do in situations.
‚ÄúLet‚Äôs hope it‚Äôs a good sign and not a sign of false security. I choose to believe in the first one.
‚ÄúThe only way to develop quality is by spending time on something. If you‚Äôre going to have shared understanding and experiences, you have to live through things together. I can‚Äôt see any shortcuts for that.‚Äù
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal - early team news
16:07 , Jamie Braidwood
Arsenal remain without Vivianne Miedema and Beth Mead due to long-term ACL injuries, while Steph Catley is a doubt due to a foot problem.
Bayern will be without Germany internationals Linda Dallmann and Giulia Gwinn, while England star Georgia Stanway will line-up against her former WSL opponents.
Predicted line-ups
Bayern: Grohs; Rall, Vigg√≥sd√≥ttir, Kumagai, Hansen; Stanway, Zadrazil; Magull, Lohmann, B√ºhl; Sch√ºller
Arsenal: Zinsberger; Martiz, Williamson, Raffaelle, Catley; Maanum, Little, W√§lti; McCabe, Blackstenius, Foord
Bayern Munich vs Arsenal
16:04 , Jamie Braidwood

When is Bayern Munich vs Arsenal?
16:01 , Jamie Braidwood
The match will kick off at 5:45pm GMT on Tuesday 21 March at the Allianz Arena, Munich.
How can I watch it?
Every game in this season‚Äôs Women‚Äôs Champions League knockout stages is being broadcast live on streaming platform DAZN, and also on DAZN‚Äôs YouTube channel. You can set reminders to receive a notification of when the stream goes live, which is 15 minutes before the start of each match
You can sign up to DAZN where the matches will also be streamed for free across their digital platforms. The YouTube stream will also be embedded in the Uefa.com and on Uefa.tv for all Women‚Äôs Champions League games.
Good evening
16:00 , Jamie Braidwood
Hello and welcome to live coverage of the the Women‚Äôs Champions League quarter-final first leg between Arsenal and Bayern Munich tonight.
The Gunners topped Group C ahead of current holders Lyon having won four of their six matches during the group stages. Jonas Eidevall‚Äôs side impressed over the first stage of this competition, scoring 19 goals and conceding just five but have struggled to get past the quarter-final stage in recent seasons ‚Äì they were knocked out 3-1 on aggregate to Wolfsburg last year.
Bayern also seem to stumble at this stage of the tournament. The German side have reached the last-eight in five of the previous six seasons but have only progressed to the semis twice and have never reached the Champions League final. Their 4-3 aggregate defeat after extra time against PSG last year saw a 2-1 loss in the home leg but they will take confidence from the fact that they won all three of their group stage home games this term, including against Barcelona.
